update.description:
![plot_hover_line.png](https://bitbucket.org/repo/jgXqbo/images/912654169-plot_hover_line.png)

there is sometimes a line hover text refresh issue, mainly a qwt problem that I will need find a workaround for. 

also made another small UI change: the canvas can now be resized using splitters

jenkins:

[homebrew](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/353/testReport/) - looks ok. There is one plotting related test failure but it's also failing in the `plotting` branch. **Update**: working on a fix and will create a separate PR for it

**Update**: Go to the settings menu icon to turn on the hover line
update.title: Plot hover line

content.raw: Suggestion to change the function to something less ambiguous, such as "HoverLineShown" or "IsShowHoverLine".
content.html: Suggestion to change the function to something less ambiguous, such as "HoverLineShown" or "IsShowHoverLine".

content.raw:
ya, I noticed the blinking when new number comes in. I think this the underlying cause is the same.

I'll add the option to settings and make it off by default for now.
content.html:
ya, I noticed the blinking when new number comes in. I think this the underlying cause is the same.

I'll add the option to settings and make it off by default for now.

content.raw:
About the panner, I researched a bit and as you said, it is a known [problem](https://sourceforge.net/p/qwt/mailman/message/26730772/). Not sure how hard that would be to implement our own solution or if it's worth it.

Not sure about turning off the text. I guess there is no harm in having the option, the question is whether it should be enabled by default or not...

Another problem which you can see in the video and I had mentioned in previous pull requests, is the right edge of the plot blinking whenever a new number comes in on the X axis. Look for example at the plot below in the beginning of the video.
content.html:
About the panner, I researched a bit and as you said, it is a known problem. Not sure how hard that would be to implement our own solution or if it's worth it.

Not sure about turning off the text. I guess there is no harm in having the option, the question is whether it should be enabled by default or not...

Another problem which you can see in the video and I had mentioned in previous pull requests, is the right edge of the plot blinking whenever a new number comes in on the X axis. Look for example at the plot below in the beginning of the video.

content.raw:
the no-refresh panning is by design in Qwt unfortunately, we would need to write our own panning tool to workaround this problem. 

The text and plot blinking is annoying. It happens in Qwt versions < 6.1.0, e.g. trusty. Most of the logic for updating and refreshing plot widgets are in private functions within Qwt so I cannot override them. Qwt changed the whole overlay system in versions 6.1.0+ and the flickering problems are not present there. 

I can make the plot line hover an optional feature that you can turn on/off in settings, maybe that'll be better?
content.html:
the no-refresh panning is by design in Qwt unfortunately, we would need to write our own panning tool to workaround this problem.

The text and plot blinking is annoying. It happens in Qwt versions < 6.1.0, e.g. trusty. Most of the logic for updating and refreshing plot widgets are in private functions within Qwt so I cannot override them. Qwt changed the whole overlay system in versions 6.1.0+ and the flickering problems are not present there.

I can make the plot line hover an optional feature that you can turn on/off in settings, maybe that'll be better?

content.raw:
This works for me, I only have a few comments about doxygen.

The [refresh issue](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JTfocs0kQYA&feature=youtu.be) is really bad though :/ Not only for the text but also when panning. The text blinks, the whole plot blinks...
content.html:
This works for me, I only have a few comments about doxygen.

The refresh issue is really bad though :/ Not only for the text but also when panning. The text blinks, the whole plot blinks...

content.raw: Can we remove the canvasLayout line?
Can we alphabetize the list here? I think it got messed up because the `Palette` used to be `PlotPalette`
content.html: Can we alphabetize the list here? I think it got messed up because the Palette used to be PlotPalette
